section.title: Post Dated Transactions
section.para: The Post Dated Transactions function allows post dated fund transfer requested to be cancelled.

section.title: Post Dated Transactions - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Post Dated Transactions function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Fund Transfers. Then select Post Dated Transactions from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the Post Dated Transactions function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Post Dated Transactions - Options
section.para: The Post Dated Transactions function allows access to the Post Dated Transactions module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, a number of options are provided for Post Dated Transactions.
The following options are available for Post Dated Transaction.

listitem.para: Terminate an existing Post Dated Transaction.
Review, complete and submit Post Dated Transaction records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Post Dated Transaction records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Post Dated Transactions - Cancel Post Dated
section.para: When the Post Dated Transactions - Cancel Post Dated option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, it will display a list of all current Post Dated Transactions in the system.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Bank Ref, Beneficiary or Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of payments are the following:

Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the payment.
Bank Ref.
Identifier the bank uses for this payment.
Beneficiary
The Beneficiary of the payment.
Product Type
The type of recurring payment.
Ccy
The Currency of the LC.
Amount
The amount of the LC.
PAB
Is the Beneficiary an authorised, Pre Approved Beneficiary.
Transfer Date
The date of the next payment
Post Dated
Has the transaction been post dated? (Yes or No)
To select a recurring payment to be terminated, click on the System ID of the require payment and complete the termination details and click the terminate button.

section.title: Post Dated Transactions - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, it allows a Post Dated Transaction request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, it allows a Post Dated Transaction requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Post Dated Transaction requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
